dmca.title: Trouble in Candyland
dmca.body:
ATTN: User Support, DMCA Complaints
2400 Bayshore Pkwy
Mountain View, GA 94043                              

Jan.23,2003

This is to file a formal complaint re: my web site, http://www.candylandcrafts.com/ which has been "pirated" by http://www.thrushs.com
    
First of all I would like to thank Google for the fast and professional response to my initial email. I've been using Google AdWords select for a long time and have been extremely pleased with the results. I am absolutely delighted that Google takes the matter of web theft seriously!

I am in process of initiating litigation against the offender, but am making every parallel effort to get their site "delisted'. I have contacted their ISP as well.

Below is a summary of the information you have requested:

1. The offender, Thrushs, has basically stolen my entire web site, as far as I can determine, on or about March 2002. They have changed the font colors, and done some very minor tailoring of a few items, but, generally speaking, the page layouts, the table structure, the images, the product descriptions, the prices (this was a surprise!) and the part numbers have been copied verbatim.(the part numbers of a particular vendor of course will be the same for anyone........but I modified the part numbers for use on my site by deleting the date codes and adding a prefix on some others) I have approximately 350 pages on my site. When I went through Thrushs site in detail, I identified approximately 100 pages that are from Candyland Crafts, (I also incidently have already sent Thrushs' the list of - 100 pages.

One other thing I noticed on their site: They have a number of product indices (copied from Candyland Crafts) without links to the relevant supporting product pages. It's fairly evident that they are still "in process" or converting my site to their own.

2. Per your instructions, below I have listed a number of specific web searches that result in links to pages taken from Candyland Crafts by Thrushs. I have listed them as you asked, by Search Query and the Infringing Web Pages URL (copied form The Google search result. (I'm sure I haven't found them all, if I find additional items I will follow up accordingly)

Search Query: ann clark cookie cutters
Infringing Web Pages: www.thrushs.com/SUPPLY%20STORE/baking%20supplies/Cookie%2OCutters%20Clark%20cutters.htm-27k

www.thrushs.com/SUPPLY%20STORE/baking%20supplies/Cookie%20Cutters/Ann%20Clark%20Cutter/ann_clark.htm- 75K
